column1: - Before starting physical therapy, ask your surgeon if you should begin to increase movement in your elbow by gently bending it back and forth.
DO NOT put ice directly on the skin because this can cause frostbite.

Ask your surgeon or physical therapist if you can: - Lift things heavier than 10 to 15 pounds for the rest of your life - Play golf or tennis, or throw objects (such as a ball) for the rest of your life - Do any activities that make you lift your elbow over and over, such as shoveling or shooting basketballs - Do jamming or pounding activities, such as hammering - Do impact sports, such as boxing or football - Do physical activities that need quick stop and start motions or twisting with your elbow - Push or pull heavy objects
Your doctor will give you a prescription for pain medicine.
